llm_prompt.content:
# Integrate Thunder Authentication in React Application (Inbuilt Mode)

## Context
I have a React application and I want to integrate Thunder's authentication system using the Asgardeo React SDK with Thunder-hosted login pages.

## Requirements
- Use @asgardeo/react SDK for authentication
- Configure Thunder-hosted login, registration, and account management UIs
- Implement sign-in and sign-out functionality using prebuilt components
- Display signed-in user's profile information
- Handle authentication state automatically

## Configuration
- **Client ID**: {{clientId}}
- **Base URL**: https://localhost:8090 (or your Thunder instance URL)
- **SDK**: @asgardeo/react

## IMPORTANT Configuration Rules
- DO NOT create a separate config object - pass all configuration as individual props directly to <AsgardeoProvider>
- Required props: `clientId`, `baseUrl`, `platform="AsgardeoV2"`, and `tokenValidation={{ idToken: { validate: false } }}`
- The tokenValidation prop is STRICTLY required for Thunder
- Optional props: `afterSignInUrl`, `afterSignOutUrl`, `scope`
- NEVER use property names like `signInRedirectURL` or `signOutRedirectURL`
- Example: <AsgardeoProvider clientId="xxx" baseUrl="xxx" platform="AsgardeoV2" tokenValidation={{ idToken: { validate: false } }}>

## Implementation Steps
1. Create a React app using Vite by running: `npm create vite@latest react-demo -- --template react --rolldown --no-interactive`
2. Navigate into the project directory: `cd react-demo`
3. Install dependencies: `npm install`
4. Install @asgardeo/react package: `npm install @asgardeo/react`
5. Wrap your app with <AsgardeoProvider /> and configure clientId, baseUrl, platform="AsgardeoV2", and tokenValidation={{ idToken: { validate: false } }}
6. Add <SignInButton /> for signed-out users and <SignOutButton /> for signed-in users
7. Use <SignedIn> and <SignedOut> components to conditionally render UI
8. Display user profile with <UserDropdown /> component
9. Run the development server: `npm run dev`

Please provide complete, working code with proper configuration for Thunder authentication using Asgardeo SDK.

manual_steps.title: Add <AsgardeoProvider /> to your app
manual_steps.description: In your main.jsx or index.jsx, wrap your application with the AsgardeoProvider component:

code.content:
import { StrictMode } from 'react'
import { createRoot } from 'react-dom/client'
import './index.css'
import App from './App.jsx'
import { AsgardeoProvider } from '@asgardeo/react'

createRoot(document.getElementById('root')).render(
  <StrictMode>
    <AsgardeoProvider
      clientId="{{clientId}}"
      baseUrl="https://localhost:8090"
      platform="AsgardeoV2"
      tokenValidation={{ idToken: { validate: false } }}
    >
      <App />
    </AsgardeoProvider>
  </StrictMode>
)

import { SignedIn, SignedOut, SignInButton, SignOutButton } from '@asgardeo/react'
import './App.css'

function App() {
  return (
    <header>
      <SignedIn>
        <SignOutButton />
      </SignedIn>
      <SignedOut>
        <SignInButton />
      </SignedOut>
    </header>
  )
}

export default App

Run the development server: `npm run dev` Please provide complete, working code with: - Proper routing configuration - Custom sign-in page integration - Proper integration with Asgardeo SDK - Use of useAsgardeo hook if programmatic access to auth state is needed

        </SignedOut>
      </header>
      <Routes>
        <Route path="/signin" element={<SignIn />} />

}
